column5: Roads are terrible in and around North Bay, including to the north. Looks like its even worse in the south. Lots of closures....the MTO website can't even keep up. I guess we are making up for the generally good driving conditions and mild winter from last year.  http://www.mto.gov.on.ca/english/traveller/trip/map.shtml?ll=50.148746,-85.605468&z=5
been watching the satellite, had a lake huron streamer over my house all day today.  wonder what awaits me when i get home.  sunny skies at work
yikes, hwy 17 between NBay and Sturgeon Falls is closed...I have to go pick up a friends young daughter at school because she's stuck in the closure.

Snugs as a bug in the shop today.. fire going.. music blaring away. Sure glad I took my compass with me though... to go shut the compressor off in the hangar. I might have ended up in the swampy area to the east of the hangar door, from yesterdays spring weather, and had to call 911 on my cell phone to be rescued!
Or you could have used the GPS app on yer fone ta git back.
I miss-read the title of this post and thought it was going to be about Crappie Rods..
Hahaha. Maybe that means you have crappy rods in your eyes...  you know, rods and cones...
You'd be assuming a LOT there Dave... amazed mine even does text..

Took me an hour to get to work this morn, normally 20 minutes in rush hour.  Was sitting there in traffic, not moving, then see a car going the opposite direction sideways!!!  Ended up backwards and took a few minutes to gather their wits and traffic waited for them to turn around and get right again  Then, of course, it happened all over again on the way home with the next blast
A young West Nipissing lady lost her life in the accident that shut down HWY 17 between North Bay and Sturgeon Falls this afternoon ..
Nothing wrong with driving like grama in crappy conditions
